title: ‘Unspeakable cruelty’: Oath ceremonies canceled for immigrants on verge of gaining citizenship
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Immigrants who have already been thoroughly vetted are being turned away from naturalization ceremonies because of where they were born.

title: Reminder: The Green Line shutdown is here
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Transportation Through Dec.
22, the Green Line's main branch from Kenmore to North Station, as well as the B branch from Kenmore to Babcock Street and the entire E branch, is closed to train service.
Passengers get off shuttle buses at Kenmore Station in 2024.

title: Well-known local musician struck and killed while walking dogs in R.I.; suspect had been arrested over 100 times
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News Rhode Island Music Hall of Famer Roderick MacLeod died on Saturday.
The crash on Saturday.
Hopkinton Police Department Rhode Island Music Hall of Famer Roderick “Rory” MacLeod died on Saturday after getting struck by a vehicle while walking his dogs in the state.

title: Tufts men’s soccer wins Division 3 national championship with dramatic comeback
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update Senior Mateo Bargagna scored an equalizer with less than 10 seconds remaining to force overtime.
Mateo Bargagna celebrates his game-tying goal to help Tufts eventually win a Division 3 national championship.
Keith Lucas/SidelineMP.

title: Mass. city mounts Christmas parade, fundraiser for first grader with brain tumor

Hadley Boucher, right, with her mother, Alyssa Boucher.
